alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 03 at 1:34PM PST until February 05 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM SATURDAY TO 10 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet above 8000 feet west of US-395. Isolated totals up to 3 feet are possible near the Sierra crest. Up to 5 inches is possible below 7000 feet. Wind gusts of 45 to 60 mph, with gusts up to 100 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 10 PM Saturday to 10 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is a 10 to 15% chance for thunder in the Eastern Sierra during the day Sunday.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. Download Caltran`s Quickmap application on your smart phone or call 5 1 1 to get the latest roadway conditions in California.
